Between the levels, cutscenes tell the story. These scenes combine actual film footage with footage rendered with the game engine.

The game offers lots of bonus content, some of which must be unlocked by completing missions or reaching certain levels with the characters. Featured are interviews with the filmmakers and actors (who also provide voices for the game) as well as various making-of features.

name: Los Simpson: El Video Juego (EdiciÃ³n Limitada)
Lost Aya Sophia
genres: Adventure > 1st-person > Anime / Manga > Visual novel > Fantasy
desc: The protagonist of the game, Yuuji Oguma, is having a strange dream lately. He's dreaming of someone being surrounded by the flames. Not really sure what to think about this recurring dream, one day he meets a girl in town, Mary, who tells him that his soul has been possessed by the devil. Yuuji is a student in a religious school, and just as the next semester begins, he realizes that the girl he met in town just transferred to this school. Together, the two of them start to get involved in solving the mystery. The game plays as a typical visual novel where choices affect the path of the story and your character's personality, which may lead to one of the two different ending.

name: Lost Passage: Ushinawareta Issetsu (Shokai Genteiban)
genres: Special edition > Physical extras
desc:
This limited edition release includes:

  • Lost Passage: Ushinawareta Issetsu game
  • Princess Magazine, extra version

name: Lotus Challenge
genres: Racing / Driving > Simulation > Behind view > Licensed
desc:
First game of new millennium to be officially licensed by Group Lotus Plc. A British company famous for their racing and sports cars notable appearances in earlier games include James Bond: The Spy Who Loved Me starring Roger Moore and Lotus: The Ultimate Challenge.

Features 42 cars spanning the companyâ€™s history covering: Formula One era (1962 Type 25, 1978 Type 79T to 2001 Formula Lotus), Classic era (1957 Seven S1 to 1986 Excel SE) to modern sports cars (1964 Competition Elan, 1980 E-spirit S2 to new Elise), and two concept cars designed by Lotus Engineers. Each virtual Formula One car is based on actual Team Lotus accomplishments, and other models were thoroughly tried by actual Lotus test drivers. A brief corporate history is also provided in the game.

â€œChallengeâ€ mode begins on â€˜Lotus test trackâ€™ beat best lap time to qualify, then select a character from fictional Lotus Challenge team in story based contest a mixture of World Series Championship racing circuits, stunt driving, and one-on-one races. Each completed segment is â€˜unlockedâ€™. â€œCollectionâ€ mode gives playersâ€™ access to every car and track â€˜unlockedâ€™. â€œChampionshipâ€ mode involves seven different championship classes of Classic cars to Super cars, only two of these can be used, as others must be â€˜unlockedâ€™ to play. â€œSingleâ€ mode lets you play a quick game of up to 15 laps of any event, challenges, stunts, and races that is â€˜unlockedâ€™.

Twenty circuits across various locations from city, speedway to custom circuits: Trafalgar Square or Buckingham Palace in London, Arizona Yuma County Speedway, Florida Jupiter Beach to Tokyo Bay Tunnel in either day or night with set weather conditions like sunny, fog, rain or snow. Circuits range from flat terrain, navigating sharp hairpins to steep hill climbs. Diversions include nine special events, four stunt sequences and nine different challenges â€“ stunts on Hollywood movie set or advertisements to car football; tasks like fleeing the paparazzi in approaching traffic to transporting against time a pregnant woman to hospital before delivery. Official Lotus test drivers offer advice on undertaking individual courses.

A variety of options are available from transmission controls, driving aids, and opponent skill to degree of vehicle damage ranging in minimum windows or headlights breakage to total bodywork and engine destruction from minor or major indentation, scraping to separable tires.

In game visuals provide information on current ranking in comparison to other drivers, laps completed and remaining, overall circuit map, transmission setting, relevant times for present to entire race time, Speedo and revs counter, three tags for anti-lock braking system, traction control and assisted steering.

Selected multi-player games have access to hidden cars and circuits that can be â€˜unlockedâ€™ by finishing agreed single or championship race.

name: Love Hina Gorgeous: Chiratto Happening!!
developer: Konami Computer Entertainment Japan Co., Ltd.
genres: Adventure > 1st-person > 3rd-person (Other) > Anime / Manga > Mini-games > Licensed
desc: Love Hina Gorgeous is an adventure which puts you in the shoes of the only male protagonist in the series, Keitaro Urashima, who is trying to get into college while at the same time performing his duties as the dorm manager. He need to improve his grade if he's ever going to get a chance to get into a college of his choice, a University of Tokyo. Taking care of a girls only dormitory won't help him achieve his goal, quite the contrary, it may lead him into many troubled situations and misadventures. Adventure mode plays in a sort-of visual novel fashion with limited time for certain choices while exploration mode lets you explore the locations in third person using the cursor to interact with items and characters around you. There are also various action event sequences which comprise of various mini-games as well as studying portion of the game which requires you to answer questions correctly and level up your character skills. Additionally, the main menu includes a bonus album containing gallery of CG events and artwork which can be seen after encountering them in the story mode.

name: Love Smash! 5: Tennis Robo no Hanran
genres: Sports > 3rd-person (Other) > Anime / Manga > Arcade > Tennis
desc:
Love Smash! 5 is a sequel to the budget tennis game Love Smash!. Once again, a secret underground organization has brought together the world's greatest tennis players, though this time they all happen to be attractive young women. In addition to the story mode, there is also an Exhibition mode for one or two players. While the game plays quite similarly to the original title, the option to play Doubles has been removed.

This sequel brings the total character count to 12, including two secret characters, each with their own stats and special moves. There are four different courts, all of them highly-unorthodox. There is a specific focus on the female characters, as each has multiple unlockable outfits and full CG ending movies. There is also a "photo gallery" that includes images of each character, and a model viewer where each character's animations can be viewed from any angle.

The game was re-released in 2005 as Love Smash! 5.1 as part of the Simple 2000 Ultimate series. This version features updated character models and minor gameplay tweaks, but is otherwise identical.

name: Love Smash!: Super Tennis Players
genres: Sports > 3rd-person (Other) > Anime / Manga > Arcade > Tennis
desc:
Love Smash! is a basic tennis game for one to four players. A secret underground society has assembled eight of the greatest players in the world to compete for fame and fortune. The game features both Tournament (story) and Exhibition modes and offers both Singles and Doubles play.

There are eight characters to choose from, plus two hidden unlockable characters, each with their own abilities and signature special move, as well as a variety of costumes to unlock. A total of eight different courts are available, ranging from traditional stadiums to outlandish locales such as an army base, construction site, and mountain top.

name: Love Songs Adv: Futaba Riho 14-sai - Natsu
genres: Adventure > 1st-person > Anime / Manga > Visual novel
desc:
First visual novel adventure game in the Love Songs franchise which focuses on one of the idols, namely Riho Futaba (åŒè‘‰ ç†ä¿), during her second year as a junior high-school student. Riho has been active in the entertainment industry since she was only 4 years old, but after being involved in an unfortunate kidnapping incident, she retired from the entertainment world and went to live in a small rural town in the island of Kyushu. The player takes a role of a rookie manager working at a talent scouting agency, looking for the next new talent. While there are many girls you will interact with, the focus of the story will be Riho once you get to meet her. However, persuading her to return to the entertainment scene might prove difficult due to her traumatic experience she has undergone as a child.

Most of the basic visual novel gameplay elements are present, from message log to fast forwarding. Characters feature lip-syncing during regular conversations, but remain still during CG event scenes. On screen text does can't be toggled off, but there's a brief delay when changing to a new scene before the on-screen text appears which shows the clear background image. Occasionally, characters appear in small window images showing only animated portraits instead of full body images, depending on the scene. All the NPCs in the game, heroines and side characters, feature full voice-acting.

The game release includes a thick booklet which features an introductory comic and a couple of pages dedicated to making-of sketches of the heroines from the game.

name: Love Songs: Idol ga Classmate
genres: Adventure > Simulation > 1st-person > 3rd-person (Other) > Anime / Manga > RPG elements > Romance
desc:
Love Songs is a dating simulation and adventure game with a setting in high-school. You are an unnamed high-school student (you create your character profile before starting the game) and your high-school is holding a performing arts course. And it just so happens that a currently popular idol, Ayano Seto, enrolled as a student here and ends up as one of your classmates.

The game takes place over three-year high-school period until graduation day. During that time you can perform various school and extracurricular activities to upgrade your character stats. You can study, train, sleep, work a part-time job to earn money, ask girls on a date and more. You can also write and receive love e-mails on your computer. Your goal is to become popular among the girls, and that means you must study hard, earn money, keep your body in shape, be fashionable, and know what to say while on a date with the girl that peeks your interest.

name: Love Songs: Idol ga Classmate (Shokai Gentei Box Type A: Seto, Mizuki Version)
genres: Special edition > Physical extras
desc:
This First Print Limited Box package comes in three different package types marked as Type A, Type B, and Type C.

Type A package contains:* Love Songs: Idol ga Classmate

  • Type A style limited edition design package featuring Ayano Seto and Yuka Mizuki
  • Type A music CD
  • Type A style limited edition desktop clock

Type B package contains:* Love Songs: Idol ga Classmate

  • Type B style limited edition design package featuring Riho Futaba, Minako Sakurai and Arisu Kagura
  • Type B music CD
  • Type B style limited edition desktop clock

Type C package contains:* Love Songs: Idol ga Classmate

  • Type C style limited edition design package featuring Ryoko Tachibana, Kana Momozono and Miyu Amagi
  • Type C music CD
  • Type C style limited edition desktop clock

name: Lowrider
genres: Simulation > 3rd-person (Other) > Arcade
desc: Lowrider is a digital recreation of one of the US' most popular automotive subcultures, in which classic cars are lowered to the ground, fitted with hydraulics, and painted up in all manner of flashy colors and liveries. Pick from 18 different cars and show your skills at hopping, pancaking, juggling, and several other maneuvers in a contest against either the computer or another player. The game also includes a custom paint feature, as well as a soundtrack consisting of either southern crunk (in the US release) or Japanese hip-hop music (in the Japan release).

name: Lucinda Green's Equestrian Challenge
genres: Sports > 3rd-person (Other) > Horse / derby > Licensed
desc:
Equestrian Challenge is an horse riding game based on three-day eventing: Show Jumping, Cross Country, and Dressage.

The player begins as a young rider at the two-star level who is taken under the wing of Lucinda Green, one of the world's most accomplished eventing riders, who trains them and their horse to reach three and four-star competitive events.

These competitive events take place at our officially licensed event locations: Adelaide, Kentucky, Badminton, and Burghley.

The playerâ€™s horse must be cared for at home in the paddock to make sure it's fed, watered, groomed, and happy. The player is also able to develop the horseâ€™s stats (Speed, Stamina, Jumping, Agility, Trust) by winning events and progressing through the game.

At the four star-level, the player must compete against some of the world's top riders, including: Polly Stockton, Mary King, Phillip Dutton, William Fox-Pitt, Andreas Dibowski, Wendy Schaefer, Caroline Powell, Jan Thompson/Byyny, Andrew Scott, Megan Jones, Dirk Schrade, Clayton Fredricks, Karren Oâ€™Connor, Nick Gaulett, Darren Chiaccia, and David Oâ€™Connor.

During the game the player wins hundreds of unlockables, including: clothes, ribbons and prizes. Some of these are used to improve your performance in subsequent events, others as awards for winning competitions.

With Lucinda Green's guidance, the ultimate goal is to win all four four-star events at Adelaide, Kentucky, Badminton, and Burghley.

name: Lucky Star - Ryouou Gakuen Outousai
genres: Adventure > 1st-person > Anime / Manga > Visual novel > Comedy > Licensed
desc: Lucky Star: Ryouou Gakuen Outousai is a visual novel adventure game based on the Lucky Star manga and anime series. Character art is more comic-style, while the gameplay is that of a typical visual novel, consisting of on-screen dialogue text with character still over background images. The game contains various unlockable bonuses accessible via main menu, such as CG gallery, music player, and more.

name: Lucky Star - Ryouou Gakuen Outousai (DX Pack)
genres: Special edition > Physical extras
desc:
This special edition release includes:

  • Lucky Star: RyÅÅ Gakuen ÅŒtÅsai game
  • Ryouou campus school uniform
  • Ryouou campus school designated guide
  • Ryouou campus school designated nameplate
  • Lucky Star collection poster set
  • Strap pendant

name: Lumines Plus
genres: Puzzle > Real-time > Falling block puzzle > Music / rhythm
desc:
A puzzle game in which the goal is to place as many 2-color falling blocks (a la Tetris) on the playing field in like-colored blocks in order to wipe it clean. During play, a timeline crosses the field from left to right, clearing and counting up your matches. The more matches you make before the timeline wipes them clean, the bigger the combo multiplier towards your score.

As you progress through the game, Lumines will reward you with new "skins" which completely change the graphics, sound effects and music during play.

In "puzzle" mode, you stack the blocks in order to create the various shapes that you are shown.

Lumines also lets you play against the CPU or wirelessly against another player on the PSP.

The 2007 PS2 port is completely identical to the PSP version, except for some new skins.

name: Lupin Sansei: Colombus no Isan wa Ake ni Somaru
genres: Action > 3rd-person (Other) > Anime / Manga > Shooter > Stealth > Spy / espionage > Licensed
desc:
Master thief Lupin the Third is after yet another high-value target: the ship's log from Christopher Colombus' famous voyage to the New World. It's scheduled to go up for bidding at the St. Mary Charity Auction taking place on the top floor of Gable Tower, an incredibly secure high-tech fortress. Of course, such defenses are but a trifle for Lupin and his partners, right?

Lupin Sansei: Colombus no Isan wa Ake ni Somaru ("Lupin the Third: The Inheritance of Colombus is Dyed in Vermilion") is the second PS2 game based on the popular Lupin the Third anime franchise, after Treasure of the Sorcerer King. Like its predecessor, it is once again a third-person action game with a heavy focus on stealth and disguises. Lupin can use a variety of weapons including his trusty P38 pistol, as well as steal items and outfits from enemies and disguise himself to avoid detection.

At certain points, the player can also take control of Lupin's teammates. Fujiko's sections are similar to Lupin's, except rather than stealing disguises she can use her feminine wiles to charm enemies into giving her information. Jigen's sections consist of on-rails shooting, while Goemon's consist of basic sword-slicing action.

name: Lupin Sansei: Lupin ni wa Shi o, Zenigata ni wa Koi o
genres: Action > 3rd-person (Other) > Anime / Manga > Shooter > Stealth > Spy / espionage > Licensed
desc:
After receiving a message from his on-again off-again love interest Fujiko Mine, master thief Lupin the Third has just arrived in the ancient city of Canghai along with his partners Jigen and Goemon. However, when they arrive at the meeting point, a mafia boss named Kouring shows up, demanding Lupin's cooperation in exchange for Fujiko's life. Of course, Lupin is having none of that, and tries to rescue Fujiko himself, but winds up cursed by an ancient black art, which will kill him in three days. Ancient documents that Fujiko found show that the Cang dynasty treasure she's looking for may also hold the key to curing Lupin's curse. But with only three days, will they be able to find the treasure and save Lupin's life?

Lupin Sansei: Lupin ni wa Shi o, Zenigata ni wa Koi o ("Lupin the Third: Lupin is Dead, Zenigata is in Love") is the third and final PS2 game based on the popular Lupin the Third anime franchise. There is less of a focus on stealth compared to the previous titles, but it is still possible to use disguises to sneak past and glean information from enemies. The player also controls Jigen, Goemon, and Fujiko at certain points, each with their own unique game style. The player also takes control of Inspector Zenigata in some chapters, a first for the series. At certain points, Lupin and Zenigata must actually work together to escape or defeat enemies.

name: Lupin the 3rd: Treasure of the Sorcerer King
genres: Action > 1st-person > 3rd-person (Other) > Anime / Manga > Puzzle elements > Stealth > Detective / mystery > Licensed
desc:
Lupin the 3rd: Treasure of the Sorcerer King is a stealth action game putting players in the role of anime legend Lupin the 3rd. Together with Jigen and Goemon, Lupin seeks to steal valuable treasures out from under Inspector Zenigata's nose. Players have access to Lupin's wide array of gadgets and disguises, which allow him to pass by guards unnoticed or to get close enough to pick their pockets.

The game plays like an arcade answer to Metal Gear Solid or Splinter Cell. The game also has puzzles in the classic Resident Evil mode. It plays out from a third-person perspective with a first-person free look option.

name: Luxor: Pharaoh's Challenge
genres: Puzzle
desc:
A Thrilling Egyptian Action-Puzzle Adventure!

Embark on a thrilling adventure through the lands of ancient Egypt in the latest installment of the hit LUXOR series. Enjoy 88 gorgeously-rendered levels of brilliantly crisp and stunning graphics portraying pyramids, temples and many more of Egyptâ€™s amazing marvels. Guide your mystical winged-shooter, swooping back and forth, as you destroy an onslaught of magical spheres before they reach the pyramid lying at the end of their path. To help eliminate enemy spheres, LUXOR: Pharaohâ€™s Challenge features more explosive power-ups than ever before!

* Prove your expertise by earning 25 spectacular skill badges
* Ranking system progressively increases power-up effectiveness
* 13 powerful blessings can be activated to make any level manageable
